intro: Tristania macrophylla, commonly known as the large-leaved tristania, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its large, velvety leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or shrubland habitats. Tristania macrophylla is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and delicate blooms.
